page.title: 04River Severn,Stockton Parish
page.content: The River Severn,the longest river in England,forms part of the western & southern parish boundary.It flows lazily amid green fields & wooded slopes & presents a beautiful aspect to Apley Hall,which stands on its north bank.The remains of an ancient fish weir and barge gutter are to be found,emphasizing the rivers importance in history as a major highway & fishing river.At Apley Forge a small stream joins the Severn as a right bank tributary.This,the Frog Mill,provided a source of water power for an iron forge in the 18th & 19th centurie, & here cannon were forged for Nelson's navy & Wellington's army at Waterloo.A little further upstream at Willey Wharf,the world's first iron boat was launched by John Wilkinson.
